page.title: 10Housing & Lifestyles
page.content: We were told by people that there were no pubs,post offices and shops in Claxton.The only shop was in a garage. There was once a pub called the Farley Inn which was closed 4 years ago in 1981 because of lack of custom.It had been running there from 1900.A new village hall has been built ,the old one had been knocked down,the bricks built some stables.The new village hall housed a club,with pooltables etc.Most of the land around Claxton is owned by Major Allhusen,he employs 5 people from the village,who live in his house.Most of the people in Claxton have to go to work in Norwich.There is a bus service from Loddon to Norwich for their shopping.There will be not much developement in Claxton as there is green belt around the village.
